title: Windows10 Insider Preview x64bit - Team Rjaa
description:
Size: 2.21 GB
Date: 06/06/2015
Uploader: mrnapo

Description
Windows 10 is all that must be Windows 8, at least that's all that Microsoft has hinted during his two events and the previous version of the new operating system company.
The first preview version of Windows 10, authorized in October 2014, the company only showed us some of the things you have prepared and the next test version will be enabled the week of January 25, the company promises to further integrate the latest news of Windows 10. However, these previous versions always have errors and you should not install them on your main computer.
This new version of Windows seeks to correct many of the criticisms and nightmares that arose due to the great change of Windows 8. Windows 10 is also a deeper unify the experience attempt computers and mobile devices, like the large ecosystem of Microsoft.

Windows 10 Insider Preview
Basically, if your PC can run Windows 8.1, then there should be no problems. If you're not sure, do not worry: Windows checks the system to see if you can install the preview version.

Insider Preview expires on October 1, 2015
If you are using Insider Preview, we'll send notifications from September 15, 2015 to remind you it's time to upgrade your computer to a newer version.

Insider Preview Windows 10 could undergo major changes before the commercial release. Microsoft makes no warranty, express or implied, with respect to the information provided. Some product features and functionality may require additional hardware or software.

System Requirements
Basically, if your PC can run Windows 8.1, then there should be no problems. If you're not sure, do not worry: Windows checks the system to see if you can install the preview version.

Processor: 1 gigahertz (GHz) or higher
RAM: 1 gigabyte (GB) (32-bit) or 2 GB (64-bit)
Available hard disk space: 16 GB
Graphics card: Microsoft DirectX 9 graphics device with WDDM driver
Microsoft account and Internet access

Important notes

Some PC processors and hardware configurations are not compatible with Insider Preview, which includes a small number of older 64-bit processors, some devices every 32 GB and 16 GB devices with a tablet operating system.
To access the Windows Store and to download and run applications, you need an Internet connection, a screen with a resolution of 1024 Ãƒâ€” 768 and a Microsoft.
The Windows Store Preview Insider has many applications available for Windows 8.1, but not all. (Applications for Windows 10 Insider Preview not available for computers running Windows 8.1 or Windows 8.) Keep in mind that if you choose to install the preliminary version, but then decide to return to Windows 8.1 or Windows 8, you may have to reinstall applications from the Windows Store.
Cortana is currently only available in English (US), English (UK), Chinese (simplified), German (Germany), French (France), Italian and Spanish (Spain). To use Cortana, country or region the system must be configured in one of the languages Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Ã¢â‚¬â€¹available and you also have to be installed in that language version of Insider Preview.
After installing the draft, you can not play DVDs with Windows Media Player.
If you use Windows 8.1 but still you installed Windows 8.1 Update, then you can not install Insider Preview. Try to run Windows Update for Windows 8.1 Update before installing Insider Preview, or you can download an ISO file instead of this.
If you have Windows 8 Pro with Media Center and install the preliminary version, then Windows Media Center will be deleted.
The draft will not work with Windows RT editions 8.1.
There is no Insider Preview N edition, so if you upgrade to Insider Preview from an N edition of Windows, will no longer have an issue N.
If you have Windows 7 without SP1, you can only upgrade to the preliminary version to download an ISO file. If you install Windows 7 SP1, you can update to the preview when using Windows Update or by downloading an ISO file version.



Important

Remember that a preliminary assessment like this can always be risky version. That's why we recommend that you do not install the preview version on your primary computer for home or work. Unexpected blockages can damage or even delete your files, so you should create backups of everything.
If you want to stop using Windows 10 Insider Preview and return to the previous version of Windows, you must reinstall the previous version with the recovery or installation media that came with your computer, usually a DVD. If you do not have recovery media, you might be able to create a recovery USB drive.
After installing Windows 10 Insider Preview, you can not use the recovery partition on the team to return to the previous version of Windows
